Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.ipt_hq

package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.ipt_hq
Color space code specialized for IPT, Higher Quality version. IPT has Intensity (roughly the same as lightness), Protan (a chromatic axis like green to red, named after the red-green colorblindness called protanopia), and Tritan (a chromatic axis like blue to yellow, named after another colorblindness type called tritanopia) channels. This package uses the "full" version of IPT, with 2.0 gamma correction applied when converting to or from RGB, and intermediate results raised to the 0.43 power; this improves handling of intensity, and you can see this in the docs by looking for unusually light colors in the darkest range (simpler IPT here, IPT_HQ here). You can use the IPT package if your usage doesn't need the higher quality and can benefit from a fast approximation of IPT.
This package is unique in that it has the SimplePalette class, which offers a method to describe colors by mixing named pigments and applying adjustments, using human-friendly syntax (SimplePalette.parseDescription(java.lang.String)). IPT_HQ was chosen for SimplePalette because mixing predefined colors is much more accurate and intuitive with this type of IPT than with, say, RGB or YCwCm. Oklab also has a SimplePalette class (SimplePalette), and in some cases it may have even better color mixing than IPT_HQ.

  • Palette by hue
  • Palette by name
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure
    Various utility classes for handling any of the color spaces, which are in subpackages of this one.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    ColorTools
    Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the IPT color space.
    GradientTools
    Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatLists.
    Palette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
    SimplePalette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
